intro: Ribes kunthii, commonly known as the Colorado currant, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other species of gooseberries and currants. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and produces small, edible berries that are dark red to black in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Ribes kunthii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
